item.title: Craig add a quote by Harlan Ellison
item.description: "You are not entitled to your opinion. You are entitled to your <i>informed</i> opinion. No one is entitled to be ignorant." -- Harlan Ellison

item.title: Craig add a quote by Robert A. Heinlein
item.description: "A human being should be able to change a diaper, plan an invasion, butcher a hog, conn a ship, design a building, write a sonnet, balance accounts, build a wall, set a bone, comfort the dying, take orders, give orders, cooperate, act alone, solve equations, analyze a new problem, pitch manure, program a computer, cook a tasty meal, fight efficiently, die gallantly. Specialization is for insects." -- Robert A. Heinlein

item.title: Craig add a quote by Neil Gaiman
item.description: "I am selfish, private and easily bored. Will this be a problem?" -- Neil Gaiman

item.title: Craig add a quote by Arthur C. Clarke
item.description: "Any sufficiently advanced technology is indistinguishable from magic." -- Arthur C. Clarke

item.title: Craig add a quote by Harlan Ellison
item.description: "The two most common elements in the universe are Hydrogen and stupidity." -- Harlan Ellison

item.title: Craig add a quote by Mira Grant
item.description: "Things it is not polite to discuss at the dinner table: politics, religion, and the walking dead." -- Mira Grant

item.title: Craig add a quote by Philip K. Dick
item.description: "Reality is that which, when you stop believing in it, doesn't go away." -- Philip K. Dick

item.title: Craig add a quote by George Alec Effinger
item.description: "Any sufficiently advanced technology is indistinguishable from doubletalk." -- George Alec Effinger
